attributes.action: amend TV licensing regulations so as to directly relate the cost of a TV license to the ability to receive all available terrestrial channels.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I live in a part of Hampshire that has always had a poor terrestrial TV signal. On analogue there is no Channel 5. Channel 4 looks like a snow storm. Teletext is intermittent. Freeview gives BBC channels only except in bad weather when a further small selection can sometimes be received. Despite this abysmal service and numerous complaints from locals to the authorities, we are expected to pay for a full TV license. The excuse given is that the regulations relate to ownership of the TV set. The government should reform licensing so as to create a direct correlation betwen the fee and the standard of transmission. Commercial pressures will then ensure an improvement in the signal.
